block.p: A DELUGED New York is the theme of the photo installation by Ana Marton that is on view at the Pratt Institute. Titled ''Immersion,'' her work, like the piece at left, interweaves photographic interpretations of the rain-soaked city streets with movie stills and overlaid text messages. The still photographs and the words that accompany them are positioned in midair behind a translucent screen, seeking to create the appearance of a dream sequence in which viewers participate.

A DELUGED New York is the theme of the photo installation by Ana Marton that is on view at the Pratt Institute. Titled ''Immersion,'' her work, like the piece at left, interweaves photographic interpretations of the rain-soaked city streets with movie stills and overlaid text messages. The still photographs and the words that accompany them are positioned in midair behind a translucent screen, seeking to create the appearance of a dream sequence in which viewers participate.

Ms. Marton studied architecture in her native Romania before moving to New York. Her work has been shown in the Queens Museum of Art, the Parsons School of Design and the Romanian Cultural Center in New York. She has also had shows at the National Gallery in Bucharest, Romania, and Museo de las Artes in Guadalajara, Mexico. Ms. Marton's work has also been featured in the set design of the Broadway production ''Bring In da Noise, Bring In da Funk'' and in Open City, a literary magazine.
''Immersion'' through Aug. 10, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily; Pratt Institute North Building, second-floor lobby of Higgins Hall, 65 St. James Place, at Lafayette Avenue; free; (718) 636-3453.
